final_answer: The image humorously contrasts the concept of sending a message that can be viewed only once with the ability to take a screenshot. On the left side, the text "YES, VIEW ONCE" suggests a feature meant to ensure privacy or fleeting visibility, like on some messaging apps. However, the right side introduces the word "BUT" and shows the option to take a screenshot, complete with a scissors icon, implying that the recipient can easily capture and save what was meant to be temporary. This irony undercuts the idea of a message being truly "viewed once," poking fun at how technology intended for privacy can be easily bypassed.
